metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: How to build an AppML Application in 2 easy steps .
content.html: How to build an AppML Application in 2 easy steps.

content.text: 1. Create a Page Using HTML and CSS

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en-US">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
<title>Customers</title>
<body>

<h1>Customers</h1>

<table>
<tr>
  <th>Customer</th>
  <th>City</th>
  <th>Country</th>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
  <td>{{City}}</td>
  <td>{{Country}}</td>
</tr>
</table>

</body>
</html>

content.text: The {{ }} brackets are placeholders for AppML data.
content.html: The {{ }} brackets are placeholders for AppML data.

syntaxHighlighting.text: border: 1px solid grey;  padding: 5px;  text-align: left;

syntax_highlighting.text: border: 1px solid grey;  padding: 5px;  text-align: left;

content.code_html:
body {
  font: 14px Verdana, sans-serif;
}

h1 {
  color: #996600;
}

table {
  width: 100%;
  border-collapse: collapse;
}

th, td {
  border: 1px solid grey;
  padding: 5px;
  text-align: left;
}

table tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background-color: #f1f1f1;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: border: 1px solid grey;  padding: 5px;  text-align: left;

content.text: Feel free to replace the CSS with your own favorite style sheet.
content.html: Feel free to replace the CSS with your own favorite style sheet.

content.text: Use AppML to add data to your page:
content.html: Use AppML to add data to your page:

content.code:
Customers

Customer City Country
{{CustomerName}} {{City}} {{Country}}
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en-US">
<title>Customers</title>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
<script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js"></script>
<body>

<h1>Customers</h1>

<table appml-data="customers.js">
<tr>
  <th>Customer</th>
  <th>City</th>
  <th>Country</th>
</tr>
<tr appml-repeat="records">
  <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
  <td>{{City}}</td>
  <td>{{Country}}</td>
</tr>
</table>

</body>
</html>

content.text: appml-data = "customers.js" connects AppML data (customers.js) to an HTML element (<table>).
content.html: appml-data="customers.js" connects AppML data (customers.js) to an HTML element (<table>).

content.text: In this case we have used a JSON file: customers.js
content.html: In this case we have used a JSON file: customers.js

content.text: appml-repeat="records" repeats an HTML element (<tr>) for each item (records) in a data object.
content.html: appml-repeat="records" repeats an HTML element (<tr>) for each item (records) in a data object.

content.text: The {{ }} brackets are placeholders for AppML data.
content.html: The {{ }} brackets are placeholders for AppML data.
